name: splashily
content:
splashily adverb
(TOO EXPENSIVE/EXCITING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is more expensive, exciting, etc. than necessary: It takes elements of the earlier work and transforms them into something more splashily dramatic. Student travellers sign up for splashily advertised gap year trips without realizing the extra costs. Related word
splashy
More examplesFewer examplesThe theatre's identity has got lost under all the celebrity-filled, splashily fashionable hype.He fills the movie's sleekly modern settings with splashily colourful costumes.The evening opened splashily with the rarely heard Sonata in F-sharp Minor.

splashily adverb
(LIQUID)
in a way that makes drops of liquid go in different directions : A couple of small birds bathed splashily at the edge of the pond. The dishes were splashily painted with bold images.
More examplesFewer examplesHe uses inks and fluorescent paint, often sprayed onto the canvas wildly and splashily.We watched a couple of tourists splashily rowing their way to the shore of the lake.
